What are the terms and conditions of using Verus software, and how can I verify the safety of the software for my operating system?

The Verus software is provided under an open-source license, which means that users are free to use, copy, modify, and distribute the software without any restrictions. However, it's essential to note that the software is provided "AS IS", without any warranty or guarantee of any kind, including but not limited to warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement.

In other words, the authors and copyright holders of the Verus software do not take any responsibility for any damages or liabilities arising from the use of the software. Users are advised to use the software at their own risk.

To verify the safety of the Verus software for your operating system, you can check the VirusTotal links provided for each platform (MacOS, Linux-AMD64, and Windows). These links will take you to a page that displays the results of a virus scan for the specific software file. You can review the detection results from various antivirus engines to get an idea of whether the software is safe to use.

It's important to note that even if the software is deemed safe by these scans, it's still essential to use caution and discretion when using experimental and unfinished software. Always be aware of the potential risks and take necessary precautions to protect your system and data.
